description: Delicious Chocolate base with a zesty Orange filling, what's not to love about this slice.
name: Choc Orange Slice Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 0.75 cup fresh orange juice (approx 2 navel oranges)
0.33 cup shredded coconut (for sprinkling on filling before baking)
1 icing sugar mixture (for dusting just before serving)

recipeInstructions.text: Base: Preheat Oven to 160 degrees Fan. Grease and line (with over hang) a 18 x 28 cm Slice Tray. Set aside.
Sift Flour and Cocoa into a large bowl. Add Sugar and Coconut. Mix well to combine.
Add Butter and Vanilla. Mixing well so all is combined. Press into prepared slice tray. It looks like there isn't enough mixture, but there is, and work it well into all the corners.
Bake for about 15 minutes or until lightly golden. Remove and cool completely in slice tray. I usually have other baking on the go, so as to utilise the heat of the oven.
Filling: Into a large bowl, add eggs, zest and sugar. Whisk until combined.
Add flour, whisk until smooth. Add in orange juice and whisk until all combined. It is quite liquid, so don't be alarmed.
Gently pour filling mixture onto cooled base (do this close to your oven) sprinkle over evenly, the 1/3 cup coconut and then very carefully place into oven.
Bake for 35-40 minutes (depending on your oven) Or until the centre of the slice is just set. Just give it a gentle wobble. No wobble and you're good to go.
Remove and cool completely in the slice tray. Dust with icing sugar mixture. (optional)
Cut into slices. Serve and enjoy!
